byline.contributor: Katie Thomas contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Generic drug makers challenge Food and Drug Admin's plan that would require them to take initiative to update their labels whenever health risks are discovered, shift that would expose them to legal liability.
lead_paragraph: The generics industry has proposed that the federal agency take full responsibility for altering labels whenever health risks are discovered rather than expecting companies to take the initiative.

headline.main: Makers of Generic Drugs Challenge F.D.A. Plan for Updated Warnings
headline.print_headline: Makers of Generic Drugs Challenge F.D.A. Plan for Updated Warnings

snippet: The generics industry has proposed that the federal agency take full responsibility for altering labels whenever health risks are discovered rather than expecting companies to take the initiative.
